name: cuttable
content:
cuttable adjective
(REMOVABLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be removed: District leaders were asked to identify a cuttable 8 percent in their budgets. There are many scenes in the film that are lovely, but cuttable.
More examplesFewer examplesHow many of these costs are cuttable if we really need to save money?She was the only person that the director believed was not cuttable from the show.Some of the longer chapters containing background to the story might be cuttable.

cuttable adjective
(AVAILABLE TO CUT)
able or available to be cut: Applications to export rough cuttable diamonds will not be considered for any destination. They expressed the cuttable timber in each area as a percentage of total cuttable timber in the state.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is the total cuttable volume of forest at the beginning of the period.The company set the values for all rough cuttable gemstones.Two types of cuttable bolts are available.
